DOC.brief_summary: Objectives : This study determine clinical efficacy bleach agent 37 % carbamide peroxide compare 35 % hydrogen peroxide change color score anterior superior teeth , in-office bleaching technique 7 , 14 37 day ; Risk tooth sensitivity , 24 hour procedure . Materials Methods : Fifty patient select single-blind , parallel , randomized-controlled clinical trial . The whiten treatment 37 % carbamide peroxide 35 % hydrogen peroxide ( control ) carry single application 45 minute two session 7-day interval . The sensitivity level assess , 24 hour procedure use verbal analogic visual analogue ( VAS ) scale . Color alteration assess bleach guide scale 7 day session 30 day last session . Relative risk sensitivity calculate adjusted session ; comparison overall risk perform McNemar 's test . Data sensitivity level scale subject Mann-Whitney test ( α = 0.05 ) . The color change measure spectrophotometer use CIE L * * b * L* , * b * parameter delta data , ΔE Δ00 , individually subject two-way repeated measure ANOVA test compare two bleach technique evaluation time ( α = 0.05 ) .
DOC.brief_title: IN-OFFICE TOOTH BLEACHING WITH 37 % CARBAMIDE PEROXIDE
DOC.detailed_description: Methods & Materials : This clinical trial approve Scientific Review Committee Committee Protection Human Subjects local university ( CAAE 50511415.1.0000.5546 ) . Trial design : This study randomized-controlled , single-blind clinical trial parallel design . The patient include submit two in-office bleach session 7-day interval receive 35 % hydrogen peroxide ( control ) 37 % carbamide peroxide single application 45 minute ; treatment allocate session . The study conduct clinic School Dentistry local university May 2016 December 2016 . Participants : Patients include clinical trial least 18 year old good oral health . Patients six upper anterior teeth caries , restoration , severe discoloration ( e.g. , stain cause tetracycline ) , enamel hypoplasia , gingival recession , dentin exposure , pulpitis , endodontics exclude . Participants submit previous bleaching procedure , present prior tooth sensitivity , pregnant breastfeeding also exclude . Only patient present six upper anterior teeth shade mismatch 2.5 M2 ( Vita Bleach guide 3D-Master scale , Vita-Zahnfabrik , Bad Sackingen , Germany ) darker include . Sample Size Calculation : The sample calculation base primary continuous outcome superiority control . Power test set 80 % , consider type I error 0.05 ; minimum detectable difference treatment 25 % , base prior study use similar bleaching agent , coefficient variation 30 % control treatment expect . The calculation result fifty patient , formula use n = f ( α/2 , β ) × [ p1 × ( 100 − p1 ) + p2 × ( 100 − p2 ) ] / ( p2 − p1 ) 2 . The calculation result fifty patient . Randomization : A randomized list computer-generated person involve intervention evaluation . The participant define block randomization process , sequence treatment ( treatment control ) randomly set block use computer-generated table ( www.sealedenvelope.com ) . The sequence insert sealed envelope number 1 50 open operator moment intervention . The patient number accord sequence enrollment . Neither participant operator know group allocation determine blind protocol . Baseline evaluation : Prior bleaching procedure , teeth clean use rubber cup associate pumice water . The shade canine upper teeth assess baseline spectrophotometer Vita EasyShade ( Vita-Zahnfabrik , Bad Säckinge , Germany ) use CIE L * * b * . 3 measurement tooth conduct , end result average 3 value ( L * , * b * ) . Intervention : Control treatment : A light-cured resin dam apply ( Top Dam , FGM , Joinville , SC , Brazil ) gingival tissue correspond teeth bleach . A 35 % hydrogen peroxide base bleaching agent ( Whiteness HP Maxx , FGM , Joinville , SC , Brazil ) mix apply vestibular surface teeth , ratio 1 drop every 3 thickener peroxide , remain 45 minute . After time , bleach agent remove . A second session carry 1 week follow procedure . Experimental Treatment : A 37 % carbamide peroxide base bleaching agent ( Power bleaching , BM4 , Palhoça , SC , Brazil ) apply vestibular surface teeth relative isolation use cotton roller , remain 45 minute . After time , bleach agent remove . A second session carry 1 week follow procedure . Evaluations : The tooth sensitivity report patient assess use visual analog scale ( VAS ) verbal rating scale ( VRS ) . The VAS consist scale 10 cm length range 0 ( absence pain ) 10 ( unsupportable pain ) . The patient set level sensitivity point scale correspond level , distance point 0 border record . For VRS , patient report level sensitivity base score : 0 = none , 1 = light , 2 = moderate , 3 = considerable 4 = severe . The tooth sensitivity assess bleaching , immediately bleach agent removal 24 hour session . One week session 30 day last session tooth color evaluate use CIE L * * b * previously describe . Statistical Analysis : For color analysis , parameter delta data L * , * b * , ΔE Δ00 , individually subject two-way repeated measure ANOVA test compare two bleach technique evaluation time . Based presence tooth sensitivity ( score different 0 VRS ) , absolute risk , odds ratio relative risk calculate regard treatment moment evaluation/session bleaching , well confidence interval ( 95 % ) . For moment , difference presence/absence ratio analyze Fisher 's exact test . For overall risk relate treatment , odds ratio adjust independent variable `` session bleaching '' use Mantel-Haenszel statistic . The homogeneity odds ratio analyze Breslow-Day Tarone 's test . Following , odds ratio estimate converted relative risk overall presence/absence ratio analyze McNemar 's test , consider study design ( parallel ) . For VRS , data score observe time evaluation/session bleach submit Mann-Whitney rank sum test . Despite measurement tooth sensitivity use VAS give continuous outcome , data assess scale show normal distribution ( Shapiro-Wilk 's test ) . Thus , data VAS also analyze Mann-Whitney rank sum test , one test per time evaluation carry . All statistical analysis perform consider 95 % significance level ( α = 0.05 ) .

Patients six upper anterior teeth caries , restoration , severe discoloration ( e.g. , stain cause tetracycline ) , enamel hypoplasia , gingival recession , dentin exposure , pulpitis , endodontics exclude . Participants submit previous bleaching procedure , present prior tooth sensitivity , pregnant breastfeeding also exclude .
